title: The future of materials - Deloitte
summary: Eastman, a global specialty materials company, is innovating to implement sustainable practices through chemical recycling projects that utilize existing assets to reduce plastic waste and associated emissions. The company is reviving Kodak's old methanolysis technology for polyester recycling and introducing Carbon Renewal Technology for complex waste plastics. Eastman aims to recycle significant quantities of plastic waste and reduce greenhouse gas emissions while working with partners to enhance supply chain operations. The firm is committed to enhancing recycling capabilities and the circular economy through innovative practices and collaborations.

title: 85% of Vestiaire Resale Shoppers Buying Less But Better - Sourcing Journal
summary: Vestiaire Collective's second annual Impact Report highlights the positive environmental impacts of its fashion resale platform, which encourages consumers to buy used garments, thereby extending their life and reducing carbon emissions. The report reveals that buying pre-loved items can reduce environmental impact significantly, and the company has established a net climate-positive impact through its initiatives. Additionally, Vestiaire Collective's resale-as-a-service (RaaS) model further promotes sustainability in the fashion industry by incentivizing brands to resell items. The company actively lobbies for accountability among fast fashion companies and has banned multiple brands from its platform.

title: Animal byproducts provide opportunity to cut carbon footprint of feed - Aquafeed.com
summary: The article discusses the advantages of using locally produced Processed Animal Proteins (PAPs) and rendered fat as replacements for soy meal and palm oil in animal feed, highlighting reduced carbon emissions compared to vegetable alternatives. A lifecycle analysis indicates that animal byproducts (ABPs) not only lower the carbon footprint but also support sustainability in feed production, particularly following new EU regulations against deforestation. The study shows that PAPs and rendered fats have higher protein content and a lower overall environmental impact than conventional plant-based feed ingredients.

title: Industry orgs backs new bill set to offer regulatory pathway for non-nutritive animal food products - Pet Food Processing
summary: The American Feed Industry Association (AFIA) supports the Innovative Feed Enhancement and Economic Development Act of 2023, which aims to create a regulatory pathway for non-nutritive animal feed additives that can improve animal health and reduce environmental impact. The act introduces a new category, zootechnical animal food substances (ZAFS), which are regulated as food additives rather than drugs. This legislative change is expected to enhance innovation in the industry and improve the competitive position of US farmers and ranchers. The AFIA urges Congress to pass the bill swiftly to enable the development of solutions that benefit animal health and the environment.

Both founders emphasize redefining beauty standards and normalizing the conversation around body scars linked to motherhood. The campaign seeks to empower women to embrace their uniqueness and resilience.

title: Thankyou unveils what’s next - Retail World
summary: Thankyou has reimagined its personal care products and launched into the home cleaning category with a focus on sustainability. The new range includes bottles made from 98% recycled plastic, refillable aluminum bottles, and a 100% natural universal cleaner that is both affordable and effective. Additionally, the cleaning products are formulated to be free from harsh chemicals and are accompanied by environmentally friendly microfibre cloths. These products will be available in major retailers and through a new e-commerce site.

green_product: TRUE, because the products are designed to minimize environmental impact through sustainable materials and processes, fulfilling the definition of a green product.
green_process: TRUE, as the information indicates processes that utilize recycled materials, and production methods that reduce environmental impact, aligning with the definition of a green process.
